page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content: Many of those who work in the area are engaged in agriculture, as farmers or farmworkers, or in producing animal food. Agricultural workers usually live close to the farms, whereas the mill employees travel in from other areas. Self-employed residents include a carpenter, a mobile greengrocer, a shop interior designer and an importer of ladies' underwear. However, most of the inhabitants are employed in other areas, commuting to London and other major towns, or working as area managers or sales representatives. There are few opportunities for young people to find work locally, and many move away to seek employment. In particular, those who leave to obtain further education or professional qualifications seldom return.
